poem:
### At COP30

In the corridors thick with bustling suits,  
they speak of "big four" agreements and disinformation,  
where facts form the cobblestones of trust,  
an architecture of democracy built on whispers.  
Yet, amid slogans that crinkle like old paper,  
a voice insists, softly, "This is not,"  
reminding us that beneath the veneer,  
there's still unraveling to be done.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
